Last update: Oct 9, 2013,  10 a.m. LAH

Name: gou zhua dou
狗爪豆
Other name: long zhua li dou 龍爪黎豆

Geography: Originated in southern and eastern Asia.
Cultivated in Guangdong, Guangxi, Hainan, Taiwan, Yunnan, Guizhou, Hunan, Sichuan, Jiangxi, Jiangsu, Zhejiang provinces of China. [4]
Maladies Treated: Blood heat: use young leaves to rub all over the body
Medical Function:
Antibacterial activity: Antimicrobial study results showed promising antibacterial activity of Mucuna cochinchinensis seed extracts against all the bacteria tested. Among these, methanolic extract was found to have more potent inhibitory effect compared with ethyl acetate extract. Acetate extract showed some degree of antibacterial properties against Escherichia coli, Klebsiella pneumoniae and Bacillus subtilis. Fungi tested were resistant to both of the ethyl acetate extract and acetate extract. [1]

The seed extract may possess the potential for the treatment of various bacterial infections. [1]
Dosage:
Oral: in decoction 9 - 12 g. Or use fresh item 30-60 g each time as vegetable.
內服：煎湯，9-12克，或用鮮品煮食，每次30-60克。
Samples of Formulae:
For treatment of lumbar pain: gou zhua dou (gou zhua dou) 60 to 90 g, stew with pig kidney. Take orally. [5]

For treatment of blood heat: use young leaves to rub all over the body. [6]
Contraindications: This is one of the toxic plants included in the "The Chinese Plant Species Database of Toxic Plants". The pods and seeds are poisonous, but after 2-3 days of soaking or after boiling and soak for one day, it can be used as a vegetable. Frequently when not processed enough to remove the toxin, poisoning occurs. More acute onset of symptoms of the nervous system and digestive system generally occur within 0.5 to 3 hours. Symptoms can include chills, dizziness, headache, weakness, limb numbness, muscle trembling; and in severe cases, miosis, convulsions, difficulty breathing, coma, as well as nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea and other symptoms can occur.
References: [2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草
[4] Database of Feed Vegetation of China 中國飼用植物圖譜數據庫
[5] Zhejiang Tian Mu Shan Medical Journal《浙江天目山藥植志》
[6] Guangxi Herbal Medicine List 《廣西藥植名錄》
Further Reading: Ref: Baidu Encyclopedia 請參考：百度百科

ChevalPron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕kusoutouPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕ Pron. in Cantonese::粵音﹕gau2 zaau2 dau6Other Names:別名﹕li dou黎豆long zhua li dou龍爪黎豆hu zhua dou虎爪豆mao dou貓豆gou zheng dou狗踭豆mao zhua dou貓爪豆Common Name:英文名﹕Bengal beansDistribution:產地﹕Originated in southern and eastern Asia. It is being cultivated in Guangdong, Guangxi, Hainan, Taiwan, Yunnan, Guizhou, Hunan, Sichuan, Jiangxi, Jiangsu, Zhejiang and other provinces of China. [4]原產 亞洲南部和東部。現今廣東、廣西，海南、台灣、雲南，貴 州、湖南、四川、江西、江蘇，浙江等省區均有栽培。[4]Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕warm, sweet, slightly bitter, some toxicity.性溫，味甘微苦，有小毒Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕spleen, stomach, liver, kidney.脾，胃，肝，腎。Medical functions:藥理﹕ Antimicrobial study results showed promising antibacterial activity of Mucuna cochinchinensis seed extracts against all the bacteria tested. Among these, methanolic extract was found to have more potent inhibitory effect comparing with ethyl acetate extract. Acetate extract showed some degree of antibacterial properties against Escherichia coli, Klebsiella pneumoniae and Bacillus subtilis.  Fungi tested were resistant to both of the ethyl acetate extract and acetate extract.[1]The seed extract may possess the potential for the treatment of various bacterial infections.[1]抗菌研究結果顯示，狗爪豆的提取物對所有測試細菌有很可能的抗菌活性。其中，甲醇提取物被發現具有用乙酸乙酯萃取 相比較更有效的抑制作用。醋酸提取物顯示有些對大腸桿菌，肺 炎克雷伯氏菌和枯草芽孢桿菌的抗菌作用。真菌測試顯示對乙酸乙酯萃取物和乙酸乙酯萃取物有耐性 。[1]狗爪豆的提取物可能有潛在的用途對治療細菌感染【1】Actions & Indications:主治﹕for gastric pain, diarrhea, lumbar pain.[5]治胃脘痛、泄瀉、腰痛。[5]Chemical ingredients: [2]化學成份﹕【2】alkaloids, anthraquinones, flavonoids, phenols, tannins, terpenoids and xanthoprotein.生物鹼類，蒽醌類，黃酮類，酚類，鞣質，萜類化合物和黃色蛋白 。Dosage:用 量﹕Oral: in decoction 9 - 12 g. Or use fresh item 30-60 g each time as vegetable.內服：煎湯，9-12克，或用鮮品煮食，每次30-60克。Samples of formulae:處方舉 例﹕For treatment of lumbar pain: gou zhua dou 60 to 90 g, stew with pig kidney. Take orally. [5] For treatment of blood heat: use young leaves to rub all over the body.[6]溫中益氣。治腰脊酸痛：狗爪豆二至三兩，燉豬腰子服。《浙江 天目山藥植志》 治血 熱：嫩葉(擦遍全身)，清熱，涼血。 《廣西藥植名錄》Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕【3】This is one of the toxic plants included in the "The Chinese Plant Species Database of Toxic Plants". The pods and seeds are poisonous, but after 2-3 days of soaking or after  boiling and soak for one day, it can be used as a vegetable. But  frequently when not processed enough to remove the toxin, poisoning occurs  More acute onset of symptoms of the nervous system and digestive system generally occur within 0.5 to 3 hours. Symptoms can include chills, dizziness, headache, weakness, limb numbness, muscle trembling, and in severe cases miosis, convulsions and even difficulty breathing, coma, as well as nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea and other symptoms can occur.該物種為中國植物圖譜數據庫收錄的有毒植物，其毒性為嫩莢和種子有毒。但經2�3日浸泡或煮沸後浸泡一天可做蔬菜食用。但往往去毒不夠，屢有中毒發生。發病較急，一般在0．5至3小時內出現神經系統和消化系統的症狀。如畏寒、頭暈、頭痛、全身無力、四肢發麻、肌肉顫動，重者有瞳孔縮小、抽搐以至呼吸困難、昏迷，還有出現惡心、嘔吐、腹痛、腹瀉等症狀。[1]DOI: 10.1016/j.jopr.2013.02.001[2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao  中華本草[3] baidu baike 百度百科[4] Database of Feed Vegetation of China 中國飼用植物圖譜數據庫[5] Zhejiang Tian Mu Shan Medical Journal《浙江天目山藥植志》[6] Guangxi Herbal Medicine List  《廣西藥植名錄》Ref: Baidu Encyclopedia 請參考：百度百科Problems with website? Geography: Distribution: Hebei, Shandong, Henan, Shaanxi, Gansu, Jiangxu, Zhejiang, Anhui, Jiangxi, Fujian, Hubei, Hunan, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, Guangdong, Guangxi provinces
Maladies Treated: Bleeding in the vagina (while not during menses)
Over abundance of bleeding during menses (by zhe shu [zhe tree], ma bian cao [verbena], yu shu [elm])
Brightening eyesight (by washing with decoction of zhe wood)
Dust, or spider web getting into the eyes (sap of zhe tree applied as eye drop, cover eyes with clean cloth, wipe eyes with water to rid of toxin)

Cancer of the esophagus, stomach, colon and rectum—clinical application indicates it is suitable especially for late stage patients; produces effect of tumor stabilization, obstruction relief, pain reduction, appetite improvement, weight gain, reduction of pleural and abdominal effusion, enhanced resistance, improved cachexia
Medical Function: In animal studies, zhe shu can inhibit U27, S180 tumors, and Ehrlich ascites tumor cells, and relieve pain
Xanthones 5, 7, 10, and 12 showed inhibitory effects on four kinds of human digestive apparatus tumor cell lines (HCT-116, SMMC-7721, SGC-7901, and BGC-823) with IC(50) values of 1.6-11.8 μg/mL
Xanthones 2, 4, and 11 displayed significant cytotoxicity against HCT-116, SMMC-7721, and SGC-7901 (IC(50)=1.3-9.8 μg/mL)
Flavonoids 15-17 were almost inactive (see [1])
Leaves and stems have been made into syrup for cancer treatment
Samples of Formulae:
For over abundance of bleeding during menses: zhe shu (zhe tree), ma bian cao (verbena), yu shu (elm). Make into decoction and use as tea. (Source: Hunan Herb Journal [湖南藥物志])

For brightening eyesight: zhe wood. Make into decoction and use the liquid to wash the eyes while the extract is warm. (Source: Hai Shang Fang [海上方])

For dust or spider web getting into the eyes: use sap of zhe tree as eye drop. Cover the eyes with clean cloth. Wipe eyes with water to rid of toxin. (Source: Yi Xue Gang Mu [醫學綱目])
Contraindications: In some cases, syrup of the leaves may cause diarrhea.
Research:
Eight new isoprenylated xanthones, cudratricusxanthones A-H (1-8), were isolated from the roots of Cudrania tricuspidata, together with ten known compounds: cudraxanthones H (9) and M (10), xanthone V(1a) (11), toxyloxanthone C (12), macluraxanthone B (13), 1-hydroxy-3,6,7-trimethoxyxanthone (14), cycloartocarpesin (15), artocarpesin (16), cudraflavone B (17), and kaempferol (18). Their structures were characterized by spectroscopic methods.

Xanthones 5, 7, 10, and 12 showed inhibitory effects on four kinds of human digestive apparatus tumor cell lines (HCT-116, SMMC-7721, SGC-7901, and BGC-823) with IC(50) values of 1.6-11.8 μg/mL. Xanthones 2, 4, and 11 displayed significant cytotoxicity against HCT-116, SMMC-7721, and SGC-7901 (IC(50)=1.3-9.8 μg/mL). Flavonoids 15-17 were almost inactive. [1]

Leaves and stems have been made into syrup for cancer treatment.
Chemical Ingredients: cudratricusxanthones A-H (isoprenylated xanthones; isolated from the roots)
References: [1] Wang YH, et al., New isoprenylated flavones, artochamins A--E, and cytotoxic principles from Artocarpus chama. J Nat Prod. 2004 May; 67(5):757-61.
Zou YS, et al., Cytotoxic isoprenylated xanthones from Cudrania tricuspidata. Bioorg Med Chem. 2004 Apr 15; 12(8):1947-53.
Puntumchai A, et al., Lakoochins A and B, new antimycobacterial stilbene derivatives from Artocarpus lakoocha. J Nat Prod. 2004 Mar; 67(3):485-6.
Syah YM, et al., Two new cytotoxic isoprenylated flavones, artoindonesianins U and V, from the heartwood of Artocarpus champeden. Fitoterapia. 2004 Mar; 75(2):134-40.
Hakim EH, et al., Artoindonesianin P, a new prenylated flavone with cytotoxic activity from Artocarpus lanceifolius. Fitoterapia. 2002 Dec; 73(7-8):668-73.
Uchiyama T, et al., Seco-Adianane-type triterpenoids from Dorstenia brasiliensis (Moraceae). Phytochemistry. 2002 Aug; 60(8):761-4.
Lee IK, et al., Cytotoxic benzyl dihydroflavonols from Cudrania tricuspidata.Phytochemistry. 1996 Jan; 41(1):213-6.

BurPron. in Cantonese:粵音﹕ze3 syu6, ze3 zi2Other Names:別名﹕zhe zi 柘子﹐ ye mei zi 野梅子﹐ ye li zhi 野荔枝﹐ lao hu gan 老虎肝﹐ huang sang 黄桑﹐ huang liao ci 黄了刺﹐ ci ding 刺釘﹐ huang dan shu 黄疸樹 ﹐ shan li zhi 山荔枝﹐zha sai shu 痄腮樹﹐ zha ci 痄刺﹐ jiu chong pi 九重皮﹐da ding huang 大丁癀。Common Name:英文名﹕cudrang, mandarin melon berry, silkworm thornDistribution:產地﹕Hebei, Shandong, Henan, Shaanxi, Gansu, Jiangxu, Zhejiang, Anhui, Jiangxi, Fujian, Hubei, Hunan, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, Guangdong, Guangxi provinces.分佈於﹕河北﹐ 山東﹐ 河南﹐ 陝西﹐ 甘肅﹐ 江蘇﹐ 浙江﹐ 安徽﹐ 江西﹐ 福建﹐ 湖北﹐ 湖南 ﹐ 四川﹐ 雲南﹐ 貴州﹐ 廣東﹐ 廣西等地。Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕sweet, warm味甘，温。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕Medical functions:藥理﹕ In animal studies zhe shu can inhibit  U27, S180 tumors, Ehrlich ascites tumor cells and relieve pain. In clinic application, it is effective for cancer of the stomach, colon and rectum. In some cases the tumors became stabilized; obstructions relieved; pain became less severe; appetite improved and gain weight. It is suitable for late stage cancer of the esophagus, stomach and colon.本品對試驗動物腫瘤瘤株U27、S180、抑 制艾氏腹水癌，并有镇痛作用。臨床對食管癌、胃癌及結腸直腸癌有療效，能使部分患者腫塊穩定，具有改善梗阻、減輕疼痛、增進食欲，增加體重，消退 胸腹水等作用，能使晚期病人抵抗力增加，惡液质改善。適用于晚期食管癌、饙門癌、胃癌及結腸癌。Actions & Indications:主治﹕Bleeding in the vagina (while not during menses), blood stasis, malaria.《日華子本草》："治婦人崩中血結，瘧 疾。"Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕Eight new isoprenylated xanthones, cudratricusxanthones A-H (1-8), were isolated from the roots of Cudrania tricuspidata, together with ten known compounds, cudraxanthones H (9) and M (10), xanthone V(1a) (11), toxyloxanthone C (12), macluraxanthone B (13), 1-hydroxy-3, 6, 7-trimethoxyxanthone (14), cycloartocarpesin (15), artocarpesin (16), cudraflavone B (17), and kaempferol (18). Their structures were characterized by spectroscopic methods. Xanthones 5, 7, 10, and 12 showed inhibitory effects on four kinds of human digestive apparatus tumor cell lines (HCT-116, SMMC-7721, SGC-7901, and BGC-823) with IC(50) values of 1.6-11.8 microg/mL. Xanthones 2, 4, and 11 displayed significant cytotoxicity against HCT-116, SMMC-7721, and SGC-7901 (IC(50)=1.3-9.8 microg/mL). Flavonoids 15-17 were almost inactive.[1]Dosage:用量﹕ Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕For over abundance of bleeding during menses: zhe shu, ma bian cao, yu shu. Make into decoction and use as tea. (Source: Hunan Herb Journal湖南藥物志)For brightening eyesight: zhe wood. Make into decoction and use the liquid to wash the eyes while the extract is warm. (Source: Hai Shang Fang海上方)For dust, or spider web getting into the eyes: use sap of zhe tree as eye drop. Cover the eyes with clean cloth. Wipe eyes with water to rid of toxin. (Source: Yi Xue Gang Mu) 治月經過多：柘樹﹐ 馬鞭草﹐ 榆樹。水煎兑红糖服。（湖南藥物志） 洗目令明：柘木煎湯，按日温洗。（海上方） 治飛絲入目：柘樹漿 點（目）了，綿裹箸頭，蘸水於眼上缴拭涎毒。（醫學綱目）Modern Research:現代研究﹕Leaves and stems have been made into syrup for cancer treatment.曾有將樹葉與樹枝製作糖漿作治癌用。Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕in some cases, syrup of the leaves may cause diarrhea.有時柘葉糖漿可能引起腹瀉。　[1]Wang YH, et al., New isoprenylated flavones, artochamins A--E, and cytotoxic principles from Artocarpus chama. Maladies Treated: Gastric gas and colic, especially for babies
Stimulating the flow of breast milk
Abdominal pain with cold sensation (external use – stir fry in pan until hot and wrap in cloth and apply to abdomen area)
Face hair thickness in idiopathic mild to moderate hirsutism (3% xiao hui xiang gel used topically compared with placebo shows significant reduction by microscopic analysis)
Medical Function: Anti-fungal effect. Fennel oil samples have shown high activity against Candida albicans. [2][5]
Antioxidant activity. [1][7]
Releases stored fat for consumption by the body. [3]
Potential in preventing bone loss in postmenopausal osteoporosis by reducing both osteoclast differentiation and function. [4]
Prevents hepatic fibrosis in rats by reducing collagen fiber and improves hepatic function. [6]
Emmenagogue effects (promotes menstrual blood flow)
Increases kidney activity and decreases urea rate. [9]
Increases progesterone levels. [10]
Gel of 3% xiao hui xiang decreased hair thickness in idiopathic mild to moderate hirsutism. [10]
Aqueous extract of fennel seed showed beneficial effect (especially at dose of 150 mg/kg body weight) on renal function in rats with polycystic ovarian syndrome. [11]
Possesses oestrogenic activity [12]
Dosage: 3 to 20 g. Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g. (3～20克。濃縮中藥：0.5～2克)
Samples of Formulae:
1. an zhong san (安中散)
2. nuan gan tang (暖肝湯)
 3. External use in abdominal pain: stir fry in pan until hot and wrap in cloth and apply to abdomen area for pain and cold sensation.
Contraindications:
Use caution in cases of yinxu (yin deficiency) and lack of liquid. 
Not recommended for pregnant women with weak constitution or use with care when using it, because the herb has estrogenic activity. 
May not be suitable to use with Fluoroquinolone drugs, including: ciprofloxacin (Cipro), enoxacin (Penetrex), lomefloxacin (Maxaquin), norfloxacin (Noroxin), ofloxacin (Floxin), sparfloxacin (Zagam), levofloxacin (Levaquin), grepafloxacin (Raxar), trovafloxacin/alatrofloxacin (Trovan), and others. 
The estrogenic activity of this herb brings some side effects such as decrease in protein concentration and acid and alkaline phosphatase in male genital organs, increase in weight of mammary glands and reproductive organs in women and premature breast development in girls. [7]
Research:
Anti-fungal effect: Fennel oil samples have shown high activity against Candida albicans. [2][5]
Antioxidant effect. [1][7]
Releases stored fat for consumption by the body. [3]
Potential in preventing bone loss in postmenopausal osteoporosis by reducing both osteoclast differentiation and function. [4]
Prevents hepatic fibrosis in rats by reducing collagen fiber and improves hepatic function. [6]
Emmenagogue effects (promotes menstrual blood flow).
Increases kidney activity and decreases urea rate. [9]
Increases progesterone levels. [10]
A 3% fennel gel reduced the thickness of facial hair in idiopathic mild to moderate hirsutism compared with placebo, as determined by microscopic analysis. [10]
Aqueous extract of fennel seed showed a beneficial effect (especially at dose of 150 mg/kg body weight) on renal function in rats with polycystic ovarian syndrome. [11]
Possesses oestrogenic activity. [12]
The estrogenic activity of xiao hui xiang may cause certain side effects such as decrease in protein concentration and acid and alkaline phosphatase in male genital organs, increased weight of mammary glands and reproductive organs in women, and premature breast development in girls. [7]
References: [5] Rev Med Chir Soc Med Nat Iasi. 2008 Jul-Sep;112(3):832-6.

Concentrated extract: 0.5 to 2 g.3～20克。濃縮中藥：0.5～2克 。Samples of formulae:處方舉 例﹕1. an zhong san2. nuan gan tang 1. 安中散2. 暖肝湯Modern Research:現代研究﹕See bibliography below.Cautions:禁忌﹕Use caution in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) and lack of liquid.Not recommended for pregnant women with weak constitution or use with care when using it. because the herb has estrogenic activity.may not suitable to use with Fluoroquinolone drugsThe estrogenic activity of this herb brings some side effects such as decrease in protein concentration and acid and alkaline phosphatase in male genital organs, increase in weight of mammary glands and reproductive organs in women and premature breast developing in girls[7] 陰虛 津液不足者慎用。體質太虛弱的孕婦忌服或慎服, 因為本品有雌激素樣的活性。[7]不宜和氟 喹諾酮類藥物同用。本品的雌激素活性可能引起一些副作用，如降低蛋白質濃度和男性生殖器官的酸性和鹼性磷酸酶，乳腺增大及生殖器官婦女和女孩乳房過早發育[7]Fluoroquinolone drugs include:ciprofloxacin (Cipro) enoxacin (Penetrex) lomefloxacin (Maxaquin) norfloxacin (Noroxin) ofloxacin (Floxin) sparfloxacin (Zagam) levofloxacin (Levaquin) grepafloxacin (Raxar) trovafloxacin/alatrofloxacin (Trovan) and others 氟喹諾酮類藥物包括： 環丙沙星（Cipro） 諾沙星（Penetrex） 洛美沙星（Maxaquin） 諾氟沙星（Noroxin） 氧氟沙星（Floxin） 司帕沙星（Zagam） 左氧氟沙星（Levaquin） 格帕沙星（Raxar） 曲伐沙星/阿拉曲伐沙星（Trovan） 以及其他  We thank Paul Pilkington of Australia for financial contribution of this webpage.[1] Pharmacognosy Res. 2012 Apr;4(2):104-8.[2] Indian J Dent Res. 2010 Jul-Sep;21(3):334-6.[3] http://dailymed.nlm.nih.gov/dailymed/lookup.cfm?setid=9bf57bf0-6574-4f6d-99f3-0b0f50503357[4] Int J Mol Med. 2012 Jun;29(6):1053-9. doi: 10.3892/ijmm.2012.950. Name: ma qian zi
fan mu bi
Other name: ku shi ba dou er 苦實把豆兒 (《飛鴻集》)
huo shi ke ba du 火失刻把都 (《綱目》)
ku shi 苦實 (《本草原始》)
niu yin 牛銀 (《本草求原》)
ba da fang 大方八 (《中藥材手冊》)

Geography: Malaysia (northern peninsular, main production area; distribution)
Philippines (introduced and locally naturalized in Mindoro; distribution)
China (Yunnan: main production area of Yunnan ma qian zi)
Maladies Treated: organic disorders of the heart and circulatory system
functional disorders of the heart and circulatory system
sore throat pain due to Heat (咽喉痺痛)
skin abscesses and swellings (癰疽腫毒)

facial paralysis (Bell's palsy) (臉神經麻痺): treated with external application of sliced ma qian zi 3.6g, cut into 19-24 slices, applied to affected area on medical plaster tape (applied to left sides if tilted to right and vice versa), changed every 7-10 days until normal. Usually, in mild cases 2 applications suffice. Treated 15,000 patients, 80% effective.

myasthenia gravis (重症肌無力): for oral use after special processing (see Samples of Formulae). Start with 1.5 fen/day (0.45g), increasing to 3.2-4 fen/day (0.96–1.2g) in 3 divided doses. Caution: extremely toxic, to be used under expert supervision.

tuberculosis: cervical lymph node tuberculosis, tuberculous peritonitis, chronic fibrocavitary pulmonary tuberculosis with pleurisy, hilar nodal tuberculosis (see Samples of Formulae for egg method); effect observed in multiple cases.
cervical erosion (子宮頸糜爛): external application method (see Samples of Formulae); observed in 34 cases: 13 cured, 20 improved, 1 no change.

boils (癰腫): fried and powdered ma qian zi used as pills or capsules, adults (healthy) 3-4 pills per day before bed with rice soup. Pregnant women, weak constitution, or children under 6 prohibited. Treated 1,500+ cases, all with significant effect.
Medical Function: effect on central nervous system: small amounts of strychnine stimulate, large amounts induce seizures. Rapidly absorbed orally, causes spinal reflexes, stimulates respiratory and motion centers, enhances cerebral sensory function. Large dose induces convulsions. (Animal and human studies)

effect on digestive system: bitterness of strychnine increases gastric secretion reflexively; no excitatory effect on smooth muscles of stomach or intestines (human study with direct measurement by intestinal fistula)

effect on respiratory system: brucine’s effect is 1/8 that of strychnine. Can inhibit cough in mice induced by ammonia solution or SO2 — effect surpasses codeine, stronger when administered orally than by abdominal injection. Also has phlegm-expelling action in the phenol red test in mice. Weak effect in suppressing asthma, but with prolonged application and increased dosage, enhances antihistamine action in rabbits.

curare (arrow poison)–like effect: alkaloids from ma qian zi have curare-like muscle relaxant effect. In vitro, inhibits growth of certain bacteria. Some Strychnos species from Africa also possess muscle relaxing effect.
toxic effects: early stages – spasm sensation of jaw and neck muscles, difficulty swallowing, discomfort, then severe contraction and tetany.
antibacterial effect in vitro.
expectorant effect observed in laboratory mice.
muscle relaxing effect in some African variants.
enhances antihistamine effect in rabbits (prolonged application, increased dosage).
suppresses cough in mice (stronger with oral administration).
Dosage: 0.3 to 0.6 g. Do not exceed commonly used dosage (see below for processed forms and methods). One fen (分) equals 0.3g in new measurement. Toxic; dosage must be strictly controlled.
Samples of Formulae:
1. For treatment of Bell's palsy (facial paralysis): ma qian zi 3.6g, cut into 19–24 slices, arranged on medical plaster tape, externally applied to the affected area (applied to left side if tilt is to right, and vice versa). Replace every 7–10 days until normal. Usually, in mild cases, two applications suffice. Treated 15,000 cases, 80% effective.

2. For myasthenia gravis and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS): Soak ma qian zi in water for 10–14 days, remove skin. Place into boiling peanut oil, simmer on low heat for about 30 minutes until brown and crisp (test by rolling under a jar to crumble). Remove, mix with talcum powder to absorb oil, then after 10–14 hours, sieve away talcum powder and rinse with clear water. After drying, grind into powder. Start at 1.5 fen (0.45g) per day, in 3 doses, gradually increase to 3.2–4 fen (0.96–1.2g) per day. Caution: extremely toxic, use only under expert supervision.

3. For tuberculosis (cervical lymph node, peritonitis, chronic fibrocavitary pulmonary TB with pleurisy): Crush 4 qian (about 12g) ma qian zi (add 1 liang [about 30g] Chuan huang lian (Coptis chinensis rhizome) for cervical lymph node with fistula), soak in hot water for 1 hour, then add 7 eggs and simmer on low heat for 1 hour to make medicinal eggs. Cool, eat 1 egg fasting each morning, 7 days per course, with 7 day interval between courses. 2–4 courses typically used. If eggs break during cooking, discard. Effective in individual cases (see original text for details).

4. For cervical erosion (external use): Fry ma qian zi kernel in fragrant oil, filter dregs, add suitable amount, clean vaginal and cervical secretions, insert cotton tampon soaked in ma qian zi oil ointment onto lesion with thread left outside vagina for removal after 6 hours. Apply once daily or every other day, 5 applications per course. If still not healed, continue for 2–3 courses. Treated 34 cases: 13 cured, 20 improved, 1 unchanged.

5. For boils: Fry ma qian zi in copper pot with sesame oil to deep yellow, remove hair, grind into fine powder; form into pills with rice paste or put into capsules (1 ma qian zi makes 4 pills). Adults with strong constitution: 3–4 pills daily, taken before sleep with rice soup. Contraindicated in pregnant women, weak individuals, and children under 6. Treated over 1,500 cases, all with remarkable effect.
Contraindications: Extremely toxic. Strict dosage control required. Overdose may occur at as little as 60mg. Symptoms include spasms of jaw and neck muscles, dysphagia, general discomfort, then strong muscular contractions and tetany. Antidotes: mild anaesthesia with ethyl ether, intravenous barbiturates to inhibit convulsions, gastric lavage with potassium permanganate. Avoid use in pregnant women, persons with weak constitution, children under 6 years old. Use only under supervision of experienced TCM physician.
Chemical Ingredients: minute amounts of vomicine (番木鳖次碱)
Yunnan ma qian zi: alkaloids 2.18%, strychnine 1.33%, brucine (C23H26O4N2)
Original Text:
ma qian zi, fan mu bi, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

    Alternative Healing University

 ma qian zi   
    馬錢子
 
Translated and Edited 
by: Joe Hing kwok Chu
Clinical Reports臨床報道

Clinical Reports1. treatment of Bell's palsyma qian zi 3.6 g, cut into 19 to 24 slices and arranged on medical plaster tape. Applied to affect areas. (applied to left sides if tilted to right and reverse). After 7 to 10 days, new ones were applied till normal. Usually in mild cases two applications were sufficient. Treated 15,000 patients. Effective rate was 80%
2. treatment of myasthenia gravis; amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) Soak ma qian zi in water for 10~14 days, and de-skin.  (in winter, use lukewarm water; in summer use cold water). After that puts in boiling peanut oil. Cook in low heat for approximately 30 minutes until brown and crispy (when roll under a jar on the hard surface, the seed should crumble easily) . After taking out, 
        mix in the talcum powder to absorb the oil. After h for 10~14 hours to screen out talcum powder and flush with clear water. After drying, grind it into powder and it is ready to use. .Starts  with a small amount of 1.5 fen （分）per day and make into 3 serving (0.5 fen 分) per dose. Gradually increase the to  3.2 fen to 4 fen  (分) per day. Note: one fen equal to 0.3 gram (new measurement). e.g. 1.5 fen is 0.45 gram.   Caution: this herb is extremely toxic. Use it under expert supervision of experienced Chinese herb doctors..3. treatment of tuberculosis(method to be loaded)4. treatment of cervical erosion(external application method to be loaded) 
按此看臨床報道
Pharmaceutical name:
英文藥名﹕Semen Strychni
Botanical name:
學名﹕
Strychnos nux-vomica Linn. (馬錢子)Strychnos pierriana A.W.Hil 
        (雲南馬錢子)
Pron. in Japanese:
日語發音 ﹕bsenshi
Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音 ﹕majonja
Pron. in Cantonese:
粵音﹕maa5 
        cin4 zi2
Other Names:
別名﹕fan mu bie 番木鳖, 
ku shi ba dou er 苦實把豆兒（《飛鴻集》），
huo shi ke ba du 火失刻把都（《綱目》），
ku shi 苦實（《本草原始》），
ma qian 馬前，niu yin 牛銀（《本草求原》）
ba da fang 大方八（《中藥材手冊》）　　
Common Name:
英文名﹕Brechnusssamen, Poison Nut, Quaker Buttons, Strychni Semen, Strychnos Seed. Strychnos nux-vomica.
Distribution:
產地﹕Main production areas: India, Vietnam (southern), Thailand Cambodia , Lao PDR, Malaysia (northern peninsular), Myanmar , Philippines (introduced and locally naturalized in Mindoro ).. Also found in Bangladesh , and Sri Lanka .Main production area of Yunnan ma qian zi: Yunnan province of China
        主要生產地區：印度，越南南部，泰國，柬埔寨，老撾，馬來西亞（半島北部），緬甸，菲律賓（引進並在本地歸在民都洛島）..此外，在孟加拉國，和斯裡蘭卡 
        也有發現。雲南馬錢子主產地為雲南省。
Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕bitter, cold, very toxic.味苦，寒 ，大毒。
Channels (meridians) entered: 
歸經﹕liver, spleen肝﹐脾
Medical functions:
藥理﹕ 1. effect on CNS: small amount of strychnine stimulates and large amount induces seizures. It is rapidly absorbed after oral administration and caused spinal reflexes and stimulates the respiratory and motion centers2. effect on digestive system: strychnine does not have effect on the smooth muscles of the stomach and intestines but its bitterness can induce the the secretion of stomach.3. effect on respiration system: the effect of brucine is 1/8 of that of strychnine. It can inhibit cough of mice, caused by ammonia solution or sulfur dioxide and its effect surpasses that of codeine. Oral administration is more obvious that abdomen cavity injection. It also possesses the effect of phlegm expectorant. Its effect on suppressing asthma is weak but it can enhance the effect of anti histamine of rabbit if the duration of drug application is longer and amount is larger.4. other effects: ma qian zi possesses the effect of curare (arrow poison). It can inhibit the growth of bacteria in test tubes. Some varieties of ma qian zi produced in Africa possesses muscle relaxing effect.5. toxic effect: In early stages there is sensation of spasm of the jaw and neck muscles, difficulty in swallowing, the whole body is uncomfortable, then extreme contraction of the muscles and tetany.1. 對中樞神經系統的作用： 種子中的生物鹼士的寧(番木鱉鹼)，口服後很快吸收而起作用，首先 興奮脊髓的反射機能，其次興奮延髓中的呼吸中樞中樞及血管運動中樞，井提高大腦皮質感覺中樞(皮質分析器)的機能。大劑量引起驚厥。 2. 對消化系統的作用： 用病人腸痿管直接測驗證明，士的寧對人體胃腸平滑肌沒有興 奮作用，對消化道的唯一作用，是由於它的苦味，反射地增加胃的分泌。3. 對呼吸系統的影響： 馬錢子鹼的作用為士的寧的1/8，據報道它對氨水及SO2 引圯的小鼠與咳嗽，有較強的鎮咳作用，超強度過可待因，口服較腹腔注射作用顯著。另有袪痰作用(小白鼠酚紅法)，止喘作用弱，如用藥時間延長，用 量增加時，能加強家兔抗組織胺的作用。4. 其他作用： 馬錢子鹼有箭毒樣作用，對某些細菌，在試管內有抑制作用。非洲產多種馬錢屬植物 ，其中有些也具有肌肉松弛作用。5. 毒性： 中毒者初有嚼肌及頸部肌抽筋感，咽下困難，全身不安，煞後伸肌與屈肌同時極度收縮而 出現強直性驚厥。可用乙醚作輕度麻醉或用用比妥類藥物靜脈注射以抑制驚厥，另用高錳酸鈾洗胃。
Actions & Indications:
主治﹕rheumatoid arthritis, injuries, boils and swellings, sequelae from polio of children, impotence, for diseases of the gastrointestinal tract, organic and functional disorders of the heart and circulatory system, 
glycine encephalopathy, nervous conditions, myasthenia gravis; amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
  cancer depression, 
migraine, menopausal syndromes, facial neuralgias Raynaud's syndromes.散血熱，消腫，止痛。治咽喉痺痛，癰疽腫毒，風痺疼痛，骨折﹐甘氨酸腦病﹐臉神經麻痺，重症肌無力 ﹐偏頭痛﹐ 女性更年期症候群﹐雷諾氏病 。
Chemical ingredients:
化學成份﹕
含總生物碱2～5％.主要為   Total alkaloids:番木鳖碱 即土的寧(Strychnine,C21H22O2N2,)，1�1.4%左 右，馬錢子碱 (brucine,C23H26O4N2)1-1.4%左 右，微量的 minute amount of番木鳖次碱 ( vomicine)，偽番木鳖碱(pseudostrychnine)，偽馬錢子碱(pseudobrucine)，a-及 β-可鲁勃林 (a-Colubrine﹐ β-Colubrine)等。
其他 Other:番木鳖甙 (loganin,C17H26O10)，綠原酸 (chlorogenic acid )棕榈酸 (palmitic acid  C 16 H 32 O 2 )脂肪油 (fat)蛋白質 (protein)多糖等 (polysaccharides)
云南馬錢種子含 Yunnan ma qian zi contains生物碱 (alkaloids) 2.18％，番木鳖碱 (strychnine)1.33％，馬錢子碱 (Brucine,C23H26O4N2)。
Dosage:
用量﹕0.3 to 0.6 g. (do not exceed commonly used dosage)0.3～0.6g。(毒性大，須嚴格控制用量。)
Samples of formulae
:處方舉例﹕See 
        clinical reports看臨床報告。
Modern Research:
現代研究﹕ 
Toxicity & Cautions:
毒素與禁忌﹕It is very toxic. Do not overdose. Overdoses have been recorded with as little as 60 mg.Symptoms of toxicity: toxic effect: In early stages there is sensation of spasm of the jaw and neck muscles, difficulty in swallowing, the whole body is uncomfortable, then extreme contraction of the muscles and tetany.Antidote: use ethyl ether to induce mild anaesthesia, or use barbiturate type of medication in venous injection to inhibit epilepsy and use potassium permanganate for stomach lavage.毒性大，須嚴格控制用量。 有報告中毒劑量有低至六十毫克者。若中毒可用乙醚作輕度麻醉或用巴比妥 類藥物靜脈注射以抑制驚厥，另用高錳酸鉀洗胃。
臨床報道

1.治療臉神經麻痺 ：
 將馬錢子濕潤後 ，切成薄片，1.2錢約可切18～24片 ，排列於橡皮膏上，貼敷於患側臉部(向左歪貼右，向右歪貼左)， 約7～10天調換1張 ，至恢復正常為止。一般輕症貼2次即可。治療15000人 次，約80%有效。
2.治療重症肌無力 症  ：
 將馬錢子用水泡(冬 天溫水，夏天涼水)10～14天，去皮 ，放入煮沸的花生油內，文火煎約30餘分鐘，至焦黃色(以 手缶之即碎成度)時取出，拌於滑石粉內以吸去油質，約經10～14小 時篩去滑石粉，再以清水沖洗1次，待乾後研粉即可服用。開始每日1.5分 ，分3次服，逐漸增至每日3.2分或4分 。試治3例，2例獲得較好的近期療效，1例 無效。其中1先用新新的明等治療，開始療效尚好，以後漸減，改用馬錢子治療，肌力漸恢復，握 力增加，無復視感，能自理生活。 
編者註：馬錢子有劇毒 。必須由有經驗的醫師指導下使用。
3.治療結核病：
 曾用馬錢子藥蛋 試治頸淋巴結核，結核性腹膜炎，慢性纖維性空洞性肺結核合並胸膜炎各1例，均有一定療效。方 法：取馬錢子4錢砸碎(對形成竇道的頸 淋巴結核加川黃連1兩)，用開水浸泡1小 時，再放入雞蛋7個，文火煮1小時，即 成馬錢子藥蛋，撈出放涼處備用。每天早晨空腹服藥蛋1個，7天 為一療程。間隔7天，再繼續下一次療程。一般用2～4個 療程。煮蛋和泡蛋的過程中謹防將蛋弄破，破蛋應去，不能服用。1例頸淋巴結核取得很好效果；1例 結核性腹膜炎經用抗癆藥物治療4個多月無明顯效果；1例 結核性腹膜炎經用抗癆藥物治療4個多月無明顯效果，加用馬錢子藥蛋經三個療程，腹部包塊消失 ，大便正常，僅於觸診時肝區及右下腹有不明顯的索狀物，又續服藥蛋2個療程後痊愈出院；另1例 慢性纖維性空洞性肺結核合關胸膜炎，胸水全部吸收。此外，對3例肺門淋巴結核，使用藥蛋也有 明顯效果。但對其他一些肺結核病人，在抗癆化學治療的同時加用鹽士的寧，都未見效果。
4.治療子官頸糜爛 ：
 取馬錢子仁置香 油中炸後濾去藥渣，然後加入適道，揩淨陰道，子宮頸口的分泌物，將帶線的棉塞蔈馬錢子油膏放於糜爛處，線尾留在陰道外，經6小 時後取出。每日或隔日上藥1次，5次為 一療程，未愈者可繼續二，三個療程。觀察34例，13例 痊癒，20例有效，1例無變化。
5.治療癰腫：
 取馬餞子投入銅 鍋內，加麻油炸至呈深黃色時取出，刮去毛，研成細末，用米糊為丸或裝膠囊(平均1粒 馬錢子制4粒)。成人體壯者，每天3～4丸 ，臨睡前用米湯1次送服。孕婦 
        ，體弱 或6歲以下兒童禁服。治療1500餘例 ，均獲明顯效果。

来源：华夏医药健康网 

編者註 ：馬錢子有劇毒。必須由有經驗的醫師指導下使用。
